Description: The NCI’s Cancer Research Data Commons (CRDC) is a cloud-based infrastructure to support data sharing, tool development, and compute capacity to democratize big data analysis and increase collaboration for the ever-growing volume of cancer data. To analyze petabytes of CRDC data without the burden of downloading, NCI’s Cloud Resources (CRs) bring data together with on-demand computational analysis tools and workflows in secure, collaborative cloud workspaces. All three CRs make CRDC data (e.g., genomic, proteomic, imaging) available from projects including TCGA and TARGET. In this session, each CR (ISB’s Cancer Gateway in the Cloud, Seven Bridges’ Cancer Genomics Cloud, and Broad’s FireCloud) will present research success stories and demonstrate how to take advantage of their portals and tools.
SearchResultBody: NIH01. NCI's Cloud Resources: Analyzing Cancer Data in the Cloud
Title: NCI's Cloud Resources: Analyzing Cancer Data in the Cloud
